info.title: Pluggy API
info.description: Pluggy's main API to review data and execute connectors

post.description: Validate clientId and clientSecret and return an API Key

clientKeysUnauthorized.summary: Client id and secret are invalid

404.description: Related itemId to update not found

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
ConnectTokenResponse tokenResponse = await pluggyClient.CreateConnectToken();

get.description: This endpoint retrieves all available connectors.

200.description: Retrieve a list of all connectors

parameters.description: A list of countries of connectors to filter.
parameters.name: countries

parameters.description: A list of types of connectors to filter.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Name alike look up of the connector
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Include sandbox connectors if set to true (default: false).
parameters.name: sandbox

parameters.description: Include health details about latest connections and percentage of errors (connection rate)
parameters.name: healthDetails

parameters.description: Filter connectors by the `isOpenFinance` attribute. If not sent, it won't filter.
parameters.name: isOpenFinance

parameters.description: Filter connectors by the `supportsPaymentInitiation` attribute. If not sent, it won't filter.
parameters.name: supportsPaymentInitiation

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
List<Connector> connectors = await pluggyClient.FetchConnectors();

get.description: This endpoint retrieves a specific connector.

parameters.description: Include health details about latest connections and percentage of errors (connection rate)
parameters.name: healthDetails

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
Connector connector = await pluggyClient.FetchConnector(201);

post.description: Validates a connector parameters usign the connector validation

requestBody.description: Connector's input credentials in a key-value object.

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
ValidationResult validationResult = await pluggyClient.ValidateCredentials(201, parameters);

value.message: Connector parameters do not match validation rules
Connector parameters do not match validation rules

itemUserAlreadyExists.summary: Item user already exists, avoid duplicates detected.

value.message: There are other items with the same credentials, you can't create a new one

409.description: There is a conflict creating an item

example.message: Client exceeded item creation limit (100 items) for the current subscription level.

post.description: Creates a item and syncs all the products with the financial institution, using as credentials the sent parameters.

get.description: Recovers the item resource by its id

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Item item = await pluggyClient.FetchItem("YOUR_ITEM_ID");

200.description: Update the item was successful, new sync was triggered

value.message: MFA parameter has to be updated from last execution
The parameter 'token' is required to be renewed for item update.

tooManyErrors.summary: There were more than 5 consecutive errors

value.message: There has been more than 5 failing syncronizations, please contact support

tooManyConsecutiveLoginFailures.summary: There were at least 2 consecutive login errors

value.message: must wait at least {readableBackoffTime} after {maxConsecutiveFailedLoginAttempts} consecutive login errors, last attempt was at {lastExecutionEndedAt} (can retry after: {canRetryAfterDate})

409.description: There is a conflict updating the item

example.message: Client updates on this item are allowed at most every {minUpdateFrequencyAllowedInHours} hours. Last update was at {lastUpdatedAt}

patch.description: Triggers new syncronization for the Item, optionally updating the stored credentials.

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Item item = await pluggyClient.UpdateItem("YOUR_ITEM_ID");

delete.description: Delete the item by its primary identifier

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
await pluggyClient.DeleteItem("YOUR_ITEM_ID");

post.description: When item is Waiting User Input, this method allows to submit multi-factor authentication value

schema.description: Request with the MFA value provided by the user, in the format [name]:[value]

patch.description: When client disables auto sync, the item will not be updated automatically anymore, until the client force an item update.

get.description: Recovers all consents given to the item provided

200.description: Retrieve a list of all consents given to an item

example.message: itemId should not be null or undefined,itemId must be a UUID

get.description: Recovers the consent resource by it's id
Recovers all accounts collected for the item provided

200.description: Retrieve a list of all accounts

parameters.description: Parameter to filter between bank accounts and credit accounts
parameters.name: type

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
PageResults<Account> accountsResponse = await pluggyClient.FetchAccounts('YOUR_ITEM_ID');

get.description: Recovers the account resource by its id

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Account account = await pluggyClient.FetchAccount("ACCOUNT_ID");

get.description: Recovers all statements collected for the account provided

200.description: Retrieve a list of all statements for an account

url.description: Signed URL to the statement file, this url is valid for 30 minutes

example.message: accountId should not be null or undefined,accountId must be a UUID

get.description: Recovers all transactions collected for the acount provided

200.description: Retrieve a list of all transactions for an account

results.descriptionRaw: LIQUIDO DAS OPERAES BMF PR. 14/10/2020 NC. 870947

results.descriptionRaw: LIQUIDO DAS OPERAES BM&F PR. 14/10/2020 NC. 870947

example.message: accountId should not be null or undefined,accountId must be a UUID

parameters.description: Array of transaction identifiers. If defined, 'from' and 'to' parameters will be discarded

PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
PageResults<Transaction> transactions = await pluggyClient.FetchTransactions("ACCOUNT_ID");

PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Transaction transaction = await pluggyClient.FetchTransactioNs("TRANSACTION_ID");

parameters.description: Page number for the paging request, default: 1

PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_CLIENT_ID", "YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET");
List<Investment> investments = await pluggyClient.FetchInvestments("d619cfde-a8d7-4fe0-a10d-6de488bde4e0");

Recovers all investment transactions for the investment provided

parameters.description: Page number for the paging request, default: 1

get.description: Recovers identity of an item if available

addresses.fullAddress: Av. Lcio Costa 1234, Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Identity identity = await pluggyClient.FetchIdentityByItemId("YOUR_ITEM_ID");

get.description: Recovers the identity resource by its id

addresses.fullAddress: Av. Lcio Costa 1234, Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Identity identity = await pluggyClient.FetchIdentity("YOUR_IDENTITY_ID");

get.description: Retrieves all Webhooks associated with your application

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
List<Webhook> webhooks = await pluggyClient.FetchWebhooks();

post.description: Creates a webhook attached to the specific event and provides the notification url

alreadyExists.summary: Webhook event already created for the specified url

value.message: A webhook for event '{event}' and url '{url}' already exists.

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
Webhook webhook = await pluggyClient.CreateWebhook("https://www.myapi.com/notifications", WebhookEvent.ItemCreated);

get.description: Retrieves a specific webhook

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
Webhook webhook = await pluggyClient.FetchWebhook("YOUR_WEBHOOK_ID");

patch.description: Updates a webhook event and/or url listener. Once updated all events that are triggered will replicate the updated logic

200.description: Update the webhook that was sent

example.message: Webhook url must be valid URL address and not localhost

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
Webhook webhook = await pluggyClient.UpdateWebhook("YOUR_WEBHOOK_ID", "https://www.myapi.com/notifications", WebhookEvent.All);

delete.description: Deletes a webhook listener by its id

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient("YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY");
await pluggyClient.deleteWebhook("YOUR_WEBHOOK_ID");

get.description:
Recovers all categories active from the data categorization.
Can be filtered by the parentId of the category.

200.description: Retrieve a list of all categories

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
PageResults<Category> categoriesResponse = await pluggyClient.FetchCategories();

get.description: Recovers the category resource by its id

code-samples.code:
PluggyClient pluggyClient = new PluggyClient('YOUR_PLUGGY_API_KEY');
Category category = await pluggyClient.FetchCategory("CATEGORY_ID");

parameters.description: Filter payment requests by Pix Key

200.description: Create a Automatic PIX payment request.

post.description: Creates a payment request where the payment is made using automatic PIX. Once consent is granted by the user, payments can be scheduled according to the rules defined in the request.

200.description: Recovers all automatic PIX payments from a payment request.

get.description: Lists all Automatic PIX payments from a payment request

get.summary: Get an automatic PIX scheduled payment

200.description: Recovers an automatic PIX scheduled payment by id

get.description: Recovers an automatic PIX scheduled payment by id

parameters.description: Automatic PIX scheduled payment primary identifier
parameters.name: paymentId

post.description: Retries an Automatic PIX schedule, only if the authorization accepts retries. The system allows up to 3 retry attempts. Requests must be submitted by 10pm on the day before the scheduled payment date.

200.description: Create a PIX QR payment request.

post.description: Creates the PIX QR payment request resource

delete.description: Deletes the payment request resource by its id

CreateWebhook.description:
Expects the following webhooks parameters:
event: One of the event types that are supported.
url: An https url that will receive the POST of the event.
headers: optional key-value pairs to send with the POST of the event.

transferNumber.description: Complete number of the bank account `(agency code / account number)`

automaticallyInvestedBalance.description: Balance automatically invested in the account by the FI

balanceCloseDate.description: Date when the balance was closed

balanceDueDate.description: Date when the balance is dued

creditLimit.description: Maximum amount that can be spent

additionalCards.description: Additional credit cards associated with the main one

number.description: Number of the additional credit card

consolidationType.description: Indicates if the limit is consolidated or individual

identificationNumber.description: Identification number of the additional credit card

isLimitFlexible.description: Indicates if the limit is flexible

usedAmount.description: Used amount of the additional credit card

usedAmountCurrencyCode.description: Used amount currency code (for example, BRL)

lineName.description: Name of the line (for example, 'Limite de Crdito')

lineNameAdditionalInfo.description: Additional information about the line name

limitAmount.description: Limit amount of the additional credit card

limitAmountCurrencyCode.description: Limit amount currency code (for example, BRL)

availableAmount.description: Available amount of the additional credit card

availableAmountCurrencyCode.description: Available amount currency code (for example, BRL)

type.description: Type of account, may be BANK or CREDIT

subtype.description: Subtype of corresponding type of account

name.description: Name of the account in a descriptive format

marketingName.description: Name of the account as defined externally

taxNumber.description: Tax ID of the corresponding owner

owner.description: Name of the owner of the account

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the balance

CredentialSelectOption.description: Option for ConnectorCredential of type select

assistiveText.description: Text to help the user when completing the input

validation.description: Regex validation for the user's input

validationMessage.description: Validation message when input doesn't match the regex

mfa.description: Credential is an MFA parameter and must be refreshed on each execution

options.description: List of possible values for the input

ConnectorUserAction.description: User action details for an item

instructions.description: Instructions related to the user action

attributes.description: '{ [key]:[value] }'. Additional information related to the user action, for exampke in some device authorization flow

imageUrl.description: Image of the logo hosted by Pluggy

credentials.description: Parameters required to start the connection

hasMFA.description: Does the connector require an MFA to execute?

oauth.description: If 'true', the connector requires an Oauth flow to execute

oauthUrl.description: URL to perform Oauth flow if needed

resetPasswordUrl.description: URL to the financial institution to reset the password

isOpenFinance.description: Indicates if the connector uses the regulated Open Finance APIs

supportsPaymentInitiation.description: Indicates if the connector supports the payment initiation API

supportsScheduledPayments.description: Indicates if the connector supports scheduled payments

supportsSmartTransfers.description: Indicates if the connector supports smart transfers

supportsBoletoManagement.description: Indicates if the connector supports boleto management

details.description: Statistics about your recent connections on the connector and recent connection rate (percentage of healthy connections). This field is only present if you include the parameter healthDetails=true. This will be null if there was an error obtaining health details.

connectionRateLast6Hours.description: A number from 0 to 100: the percentage of executions that succesfully connect to the institution: status of CONNECTION_ERROR,ERROR,SITE_NOT_AVAILABLE decrease the percentage. Any other status (like SUCCESS/LOGIN_ERROR) increase the percentage. The value will be null if there were no connections

connectionsLast6Hours.description: Amount of your connections for this connector during the last 6 hours. 0 if there were no connections

providerMessage.description: Information provider by the institution mainly when user needs to perform an action

attributes.description: '{ [key]:[value] }'. Additional information necessary for future executions, used for example in some device authorization flow

webhookUrl.description: Url to be notified of item changes

nextAutoSyncAt.description: Date of next auto-sync, or null if auto-sync is disabled for this Item

consecutiveFailedLoginAttempts.description: Consecutives execution that ends up with a LOGIN_ERROR status

parameters.description: Connector's credentials that are required to execute on a Key-Value object or a string if they are encrypted

webhookUrl.description: Url to be notified of item changes

clientUserId.description: Client's external identifier for the user, it can be a ID, UUID or even an email. This is free for clients to use.

oauthRedirectUri.description: Redirect URI required for the Oauth flow

products.description: Products to be collected in the connection

avoidDuplicates.description: Avoids creating a new item if there is already one with the same credentials

parameters.description: Parameters to update on the item stored credentials.

clientUserId.description: Client's external identifier for the user, it can be a ID, UUID or even an email. This is free for clients to use.

webhookUrl.description: Url to be notified of item changes

products.description: Products to be collected in the connection

StatusDetail.description: Detailed status of the item. This field will be present when the status is PARTIAL_SUCCESS or when a product in the item has warnings

lastUpdatedAt.description: Date when the product was last updated

isUpdated.description: Product was updated in the last execution

warnings.description: Warnings about the product data. For example, a warning about missing permissions for viewing a product

code.description: The warning code generated by Pluggy

message.description: The warning message in english generated by Pluggy

providerMessage.description: The warning message from the FI if provided

url.description: Url to be notified of item changes

disabledAt.description: Date when the webhook was disabled

headers.description: HTTP headers that will be included in the webhook notifications (useful for things like authorization)

ItemParameter.description: Key-Value credentials neccesary to create an item

PaymentIntentParameter.description: Credentials neccesary to create a payment intent

name.description: Name of the payer. Only required for automatic pix payment requests.

errors.message: A senha deve ter pelo menos 6 dgitos.

reason.description: User's motive submitted while making the transfer

receiverReferenceId.description: String submitted by the receiver associated with the payment when generating the payment request.

paymentMethod.description: Type of transfer. TED, DOC, PIX, TEV or BOLETO

Merchant.description: Merchant extracted from the transaction data

cnpj.description: Document number related to the merchant

cnae.description: Economic activity classification number related to the merchant

CreditCardMetadata.description: Data of a transaction specific to credit card transactions

installmentNumber.description: Number of the current installment of the purchase

totalInstallments.description: Total number of installments of the purchase

payeeMCC.description: Merchant Category Code of the merchant

cardNumber.description: Credit Card Number associated with transaction, can be different from the account if its done by an additional or virtual card.

billId.description: Id of the bill associated to this transaction

amountInAccountCurrency.description: Transaction amount in Account's Currency. Only present if the transaction is in a different currency than the account's currency

date.description: Date when the transaction was made

type.description: Type of the transaction. DEBIT (outflow) or CREDIT (inflow)

status.description: Status of the movement. POSTED / PENDING

category.description: Category of the transaction (e.g. Restaurants, Education). See the Transaction Categorization section in our guides.

categoryId.description: Id of the transaction category. Can be used to identify the category in the Categories endpoint

operationType.description: Type of operation classified by the institution.

providerId.description: Provider's identifier for the transaction. Only returned for Open Finance connectors.

descriptionTranslated.description: Description of the category, translated to portuguese

matchType.description: Type of match used to identify the rule (exact/contains/startsWith/endsWith), if not provided, defaults to 'exact'

InvestmentExpenses.description: Taxes and fees that applied to the transaction

serviceTax.description: (ISS) Service tax that varies according to state

brokerageFee.description: Commission charged by the brokerage for carrying out transactions on the stock market

incomeTax.description: (IRRF) Income Tax Withholding, amount paid to the Internal Revenue Service

tradingAssetsNoticeFee.description: (ANA) Fee of Notice of Trading in Assets

maintenanceFee.description: (termo/opes) Fees charged by BM&F Bovespa in negotiations

settlementFee.description: Liquidation fee for the settlement of a position on the expiration date or the financial settlement of physical delivery

stockExchangeFee.description: (Emolumentos) Fees charged by BM&F Bovespa as a source of operating income

custodyFee.description: Fee by brokers to keep recordsin their home broker systems or on the trading desk

operatingFee.description: Amount paid to the Operator for the intermediation service

other.description: Sum of other not defined expenses

movementType.description: Type of movement of the transaction

amount.description: Gross amount of the operation. May be null only if type is TRANSFER

date.description: Date when the transaction was made

tradeDate.description: Date when the transaction was confirmed

taxRegime.description: Description of the type of tax applied to previdencia

processNumber.description: Number of the process of a previdencia

fundName.description: Name of the fund associated with the previdencia.

Company.description: Company object that holds the company's information

itemId.description: Identifier of the item linked to the investment

subtype.description: Investment subtype, depends on the type

number.description: Reference number for this holder's asset

balance.description: The current net balance amount of the investment

lastMonthRate.description: The performance rate of the investment in the last month

lastTwelveMonthsRate.description: The performance rate of the investment in the last 12 months

annualRate.description: The performance rate of the investment in the last year

currencyCode.description: Currency ISO code for the amounts

code.description: Associated Code for the investment. For example, the code for a mutual fund is the CNPJ

taxes.description: Income taxes applied to the investment

taxes2.description: Financial taxes applied to the investment

amountProfit.description: Profit/Loss to date over the investment

issuer.description: The entity that issued the investment

issuerCNPJ.description: The entity CNPJ that issued the investment

issueDate.description: The date that the investment was issued

rate.description: Fixed rate percentage applied to the investment

status.description: Current status of the investment enum value

example.name: Bahia AM Advisory FIC de FIM

PhoneNumber.description: The phone number object contains data related to contact information.

type.description: Type of phone number: personal, work or residencial

Email.description: The email object contains emails associated with the owner of the account

value.description: The full email of the person.

Address.description: The address object contains data related to an specific owner's location.

fullAddress.description: Full address using all components available

primaryAddress.description: Primary address, stret name and street number

type.description: Type of address, Personal or Work

additionalInfo.description: Additional address information such as apartment number, complement, or other details

IdentityRelation.description: The relation object contains name and relation to the owner of the account

type.description: Type of relation: Father, Mother or Spouse

name.description: The full name of the person

IdentityResponse.description: Response with details personal information related to the owner of the connection's account

id.description: The ID of the identity to retrieve

itemId.description: Identifier of the item linked to the identity

taxNumber.description: The tax ID (CNPJ) associated with the business account

document.description: Primary document that identifies the owner

fullName.description: Name of the owner of the account

establishmentName.description: Name of the establishment (only for PAYMENT_ACCOUNT connectors)

companyName.description: For business connector, the name of the business

phoneNumbers.description: List of phone numbers related to the account

emails.description: List of email addresses related to the account

addresses.description: List of addresses related to the account

relations.description: List of names related to the account

investorProfile.description: Is a rating that indicates the investor personality and motivation for investing

qualifications.description: Information that allows understanding since when the consulted person has been a client of the institution, as well as an indicator of the products and services they currently consume and their representatives

date.description: Date when the income was informed

startDate.description: Date when the relationship with the institution started

productsServicesType.description: List of products and services that the client consumes

type.description: Type of relationship with the client

procurators.description: List of procurators of the client

accounts.description: List of accounts of the client with valid consent. Only accounts that have explicit user consent are returned.

financialRelationships.description: Information that allows institutions to assess, evaluate, characterize, and classify the client with the purpose of understanding their risk profile and their economic-financial capacity

accessToken.description: Connect token that's used to initialize Pluggy's Connect widget

AuthResponse.description: Authentication confirmed response to interact with the api

AuthRequest.description: Authentication parameters required to get access to Pluggy's API

ConnectTokenRequest.description: Create a connect token request payload

itemId.description: Item identifier to allow Connect Widget to performan an update on it.

ItemOptions.description: Item options available to send through connect tokens

clientUserId.description: Client's external identifier for the user, it can be a ID, UUID or even an email. This is free for clients to use.

webhookUrl.description: Url to be notified of this specific item changes

oauthRedirectUri.description: Url to redirect the user after the connect flow

avoidDuplicates.description: Avoids creating a new item if there is already one with the same credentials

codeDescription.description: Distinctive code description, useful to identify the error.

errors.description: List of errors related to parameter validations

example.message: Webhook url must be valid URL address and not localhost'

codeDescription.description: Distinctive code description, useful to distinguish the error.

data.description: Additional data related to the error, if any

Loan.description: Response with information related to a loan

itemId.description: Identifier of the item linked to the loan

contractNumber.description: Contract number given by the contracting institution

ipocCode.description: Standard contract number - IPOC (Identificao Padronizada da Operao de Crdito)

productName.description: Denomination/Identification of the name of the credit operation disclosed to the customer

date.description: Date when the loan data was collected

contractDate.description: Date when the loan was contracted

disbursementDates.description: Disbursement date of the contracted amount

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the loan

installmentPeriodicityAdditionalInfo.description: Mandatory field to complement the information regarding the regular payment frequency when installmentPeriodicity has value 'OTHERS'

CET.description: CET - Custo Efetivo Total must be expressed as an annual percentage rate and incorporates all charges and expenses incurred in credit operations (interest rate, but also tariffs, taxes, insurance and other expenses charged)

amortizationScheduledAdditionalInfo.description: Mandatory field to complement the information regarding the scheduled amortization when it has value 'OTHERS'

contractedFees.description: List that brings the information of the tariffs agreed in the contract.

contractedFinanceCharges.description: List that brings the charges agreed in the contract

LoanInterestRate.description: Object that brings the set of information necessary to demonstrate the composition of the remunerative interest rates of the Credit Type

referentialRateIndexerType.description: Types of benchmark rates or indexers (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumContractReferentialRateIndexerType)

referentialRateIndexerSubType.description: Subtypes of benchmark rates or indexers (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumContractReferentialRateIndexerSubType)

referentialRateIndexerAdditionalInfo.description: Free field to complement the information regarding the Type of reference rate or indexer

preFixedRate.description: Pre-fixed rate applied under the credit modality contract. 1 = 100%

postFixedRate.description: Post-fixed rate applied under the credit modality contract. 1 = 100%

additionalInfo.description: Text with additional information on the composition of agreed interest rates

chargeType.description: Charge type for the rate agreed in the contract

charge.description: Billing method related to the tariff agreed in the contract

amount.description: Monetary value of the tariff agreed in the contract

rate.description: Rate value in percentage agreed in the contract

type.description: Charge type agreed in the contract (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumContractFinanceChargeType)

rate.description: Charge value in percentage agreed in the contract

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the warranty

type.description: Denomination / Identification of the type of warranty that guarantees the Type of Credit Operation contracted (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumWarrantyType)

subtype.description: Denomination / Identification of the subtype of warranty that guarantees the Type of Credit Operation contracted (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumWarrantySubType)

typeNumberOfInstallments.description: Type of total term of the contract referring to the type of credit informed

totalNumberOfInstallments.description: Total term according to the type referring to the type of credit informed

typeContractRemaining.description: Type of remaining term of the contract referring to the type of credit informed

contractRemainingNumber.description: Remaining term according to the type referring to the credit type informed

balloonPayments.description: List that brings the due dates and value of the non-regular installments of the contract of the type of credit consulted

dueDate.description: Expiration date of the non-regular installment to expire from the contract of the consulted credit modality

LoanInstallmentBalloonPaymentAmount.description: Monetary value of the non-regular installment due

value.description: Monetary value of the non-regular installment due

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the installment

contractOutstandingBalance.description: Amount required for the customer to settle the debt

releases.description: List of payments made in the period

isOverParcelPayment.description: Identifies whether it is an agreed payment (false) or a one-time payment (true)

installmentId.description: Installment identifier, responsibility of each transmitting Institution

paidDate.description: Effective date of payment referring to the contract of the credit modality consulted

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the payment

paidAmount.description: Payment amount referring to the contract of the credit modality consulted

LoanPaymentReleaseOverParcel.description: Object of fees and charges that were paid outside the installment

fees.description: List of fees that were paid outside the installment, only for single payment

charges.description: List of charges that were paid out of installment

amount.description: Monetary value of the tariff agreed in the contract

type.description: Charge type agreed in the contract (https://openbanking-brasil.github.io/openapi/swagger-apis/loans/?urls.primaryName=2.0.1#model-EnumContractFinanceChargeType)

additionalInfo.description: Free field to fill in additional information regarding the charge

amount.description: Payment amount of the charge paid outside the installment

Bill.description: Response with information related to a credit card bill

dueDate.description: Due date of the bill, displayed for payment by the customer

totalAmountCurrencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the bill

minimumPaymentAmount.description: Minimum payment amount of the bill

allowsInstallments.description: Indicates whether the bill allows installment payments (true) or not (false)

financeCharges.description: List of charges associated to the bill

BillFinanceCharge.description: Response with information related to a credit card bill finance charge

type.description: Denomination of the charges that apply to the postpaid payment account bill

currencyCode.description: Code referencing the currency of the charge

additionalInfo.description: Free field, mandatory to fill if 'OTHER' type of charge is selected

PaymentRequest.description: Response with information related to a payment request

amount.description: Requested amount. For automatic pix it won't be returned

fees.description: Fees charged for the payment request. This includes both Pluggy's fees and any customer-specific fees. Fees are calculated based on the payment method (PIX or Boleto) and the client's pricing configuration. For sandbox accounts, fees are set to 0.

createdAt.description: Date when the payment request was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the payment request was updated

paymentUrl.description: URL to begin the payment intent creation flow for this payment request

pixQrCode.description: Pix QR code generated by the payment receiver

errorDetail.description: Error details when payment request fails

providerMessage.description: Error message returned by the institution

isSandbox.description: Indicates if this payment request is in sandbox mode. Default: false.

scheduledDate.description: Date when the payment is scheduled

endToEndId.description: Identifier for the payment, used to link the scheduled payment with the corresponding payment received

errorDetail.description: Details about an error that occurred with the scheduled payment

detail.description: Additional details about the error in the provider's language

CreatePaymentRequest.description: Request with information to create a payment request

customerId.description: Customer identifier associated to the payment

isSandbox.description: Indicates if this payment request should be created in sandbox mode. Default: false.

CreatePixQrPaymentRequest.description: Request with information to create a PIX QR payment request

customerId.description: Customer identifier associated to the payment

isSandbox.description: Indicates if this payment request should be created in sandbox mode. Default: false.

UpdatePaymentRequest.description: Request with information to update a payment request

customerId.description: Customer identifier associated to the payment

isSandbox.description: Indicates if this payment request should be updated as sandbox. Default: false.

PaymentRequestCallbackUrls.description: Redirect urls after the payment was completed or ended in error status

success.description: Url to be redirected after the payment was completed

pending.description: Url to be redirected when the payment is pending (for example, when it has status WAITING_PAYER_AUTHORIZATION

error.description: Url to be redirected after the payment ended in error status

PaymentInstitution.description: Response with information related to a payment institution

createdAt.description: Date when the payment institution was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the payment institution was updated

type.description: Receiver bank account type, could be: 'CHECKING_ACCOUNT', 'SAVINGS_ACCOUNT' or 'GUARANTEED_ACCOUNT'

PaymentIntent.description: Request with information related to a payment intent

createdAt.description: Date when the payment intent was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the payment intent was updated

paymentRequest.description: Payment request associated to the payment intent

connector.description: Connector associated to the payment intent

consentUrl.description: Url to authorize the payment intent

referenceId.description: Pix id related to the payment intent

paymentMethod.description: Payment method can be PIS (Payment Initiation) or PIX

pixData.description: Pix data related to the payment intent (only applies for PIX payment method)

errorDetail.description: Error details when payment intent fails

CreatePaymentIntent.description: Request with information to create a payment intent

paymentRequestId.description: Primary identifier of the payment request associated to the payment intent

connectorId.description: Primary identifier of the connector associated to the payment intent

paymentMethod.description: Payment method can be PIS (Payment Initiation) or PIX (PIX QR flow).

isDynamicPix.description: Only for PIX paymentMethod. If true, the generated PIX QR code is dynamic and one-use. This requires the customerId to be present, and the customer must have CPF/CNPJ

PaymentCustomer.description: Response with information related to a payment customer

CreatePaymentCustomerRequestBody.description: Response with information related to a payment customer

CreateOrUpdatePaymentCustomer.description: Response with information related to a payment customer

PaymentRecipient.description: Response with information related to a payment recipient

taxNumber.description: Account owner tax number. Can be CPF or CNPJ (only numbers).

isDefault.description: Indicates if the recipient is the default one

pixKey.description: Pix key associated with the payment recipient

CreatePaymentRecipient.description: Request with information to create a payment recipient.

taxNumber.description: Account owner tax number. Can be CPF or CNPJ (only numbers)

paymentInstitutionId.description: Primary identifier of the institution associated to the payment recipient.

UpdatePaymentRecipient.description: Request with information to update a payment recipient

taxNumber.description: Account owner tax number. Can be CPF or CNPJ (only numbers)

paymentInstitutionId.description: Primary identifier of the institution associated to the payment recipient.

qr.description: PIX QR image in base64 format

expirationDate.description: After this date, the boleto cannot be paid

baseAmount.description: Boleto original amount, without interests, penalties and discounts

penaltyAmount.description: Boleto penalty amount. If there is no penalty, it will be returned as zero

interestAmount.description: Boleto interest amount. If there is no interest, it will be returned as zero

discountAmount.description: Boleto discount amount. If there is no discounts, it will be returned as zero

totalAmount.description: Boleto final amount. It is equal to the base amount plus penalties and interests, minus discounts

updatedAt.description: Date when the lastest information of this boleto has been retrieved

SINGLE.title: One time option
SINGLE.description: Schedule atribute to generate one payment in the future

DAILY.title: Daily option
DAILY.description: Schedule atribute to generate daily payments

startDate.description: The start date of the validity of the scheduled payment authorization.

occurrences.description: Under the specified schedule frequency, how many payments will be scheduled to occur.

WEEKLY.title: Weekly option
WEEKLY.description: Schedule atribute to generate weekly payments

startDate.description: The start date of the validity of the scheduled payment authorization.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week on which each payment will occur. For instance, if set to 'MONDAY', the first payment will occur on the first monday after the startDate (or the same day, if it is already monday), and every monday after that.

occurrences.description: Under the specified schedule frequency, how many payments will be scheduled to occur.

MONTHLY.title: Monthly option
MONTHLY.description: Schedule atribute to generate monthly payments

dayOfMonth.description: Day of the month on which each payment will occur. For example, if '10', the first payment will occur on the next 10th day of the month after the start date, or the same day if it is already 10th, and every 10th day after that.

occurrences.description: Under the specified schedule frequency, how many payments will be scheduled to occur.

CUSTOM.title: Customized option
CUSTOM.description: Schedule atribute to generate custom payments in the future

additionalInformation.description: Additional information about the custom schedule

itemId.description: Primary identifier of the item associated to the consent

products.description: Products to be collected in the connection

openFinancePermissionsGranted.description: Products consented by the user to be collected

createdAt.description: Date when the consent was given

expiresAt.description: Date when the consent expires. Null if the consent doesn't expire

revokedAt.description: Date when the consent was revoked

consentUrl.description: Url to give the consent in the institution

createdAt.description: Date when the preauthorization was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the preauthorization was updated

SmartTransferCallbackUrls.description: Redirect urls after the preauthorization flow was completed or ended in error status

success.description: Url to be redirected after the preauthorization was completed

error.description: Url to be redirected after the preauthorization ended in error status

CreateSmartTransferPreauthorization.description: Create smart transfer preauthorization request data

items.description: Primary identifier of the payment recipient

SmartTransferPreauthorizationParameter.description: Credentials neccesary to create a smart transfer preauthorization

createdAt.description: Date when the payemnt was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the payment was updated

CreateSmartTransferPayment.description: Create smart transfer payment request data

recipientId.description: Primary identifier of the paymen recipient

PaymentDataBoletoMetadata.description: Information of the boleto associated with the payment

baseAmount.description: Boleto original amount without considering penalties / interests / discounts

CreateBoletoConnection.description: Request with information to create a boleto connection

connectorId.description: Connector identifier. Check out the list of connectors, and if it has the flag 'supportsBoletoManagement' as true, it means it's possible to create a boleto connection with it.

credentials.description: Credentials required for the connection. For Inter, they are clientId, clientSecret, certificate and privateKey, follow: https://docs.pluggy.ai/docs/connect-an-account#inter-pj

CreateBoletoConnectionFromItem.description: Request with information to create a boleto connection from an Item

BoletoConnection.description: Response with information related to a boleto connection

connectorId.description: Primary identifier of the connector associated with this connection

createdAt.description: Date when the connection was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the connection was last updated

CreateBoleto.description: Request with information to create a boleto

boletoConnectionId.description: Primary identifier of the boleto connection

dueDate.description: Due date for the boleto. Must be today or in the future.

IssuedBoleto.description: Response with information related to an issued boleto

amountPaid.description: Amount paid or null if it hasn't been paid yet

nossoNumero.description: Bank's internal identifier for the boleto

boletoConnectionId.description: ID of the boleto connection used to create this boleto

createdAt.description: Date when the boleto was created

amountPaid.description: Amount that was paid for this boleto

paymentOrigin.description: Origin of the payment when the boleto is paid

paidAt.description: Date when the boleto was paid

fixedAmount.description: Fixed charge amount; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of fixed amounts, not subject to change during the validity of the consent. If it's sent, minimumVariableAmount and maximumVariableAmount cannot be provided.

minimumVariableAmount.description: Minimum amount allowed per charge; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of variable amounts. If it's sent, fixedAmount cannot be provided.

maximumVariableAmount.description: Maximum amount allowed per charge; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of variable amounts. If it's sent, fixedAmount cannot be provided.

description.description: Description for the automatic pix authorization

startDate.description: Represents the expected date for the first occurrence of a payment associated with the recurrence. Date format must be YYYY-MM-DD (for example: 2025-06-16)

expiresAt.description: Expiration date for the automatic pix authorization. The date must be in UTC and the format must follow the following pattern: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ (for example: 2025-06-16T03:00:00Z).

isRetryAccepted.description: Indicates whether the receiving customer is allowed to make payment attempts, according to the rules established in the Pix arrangement.

interval.description: Defines the permitted frequency for carrying out transactions.

recipientId.description: Primary identifier of the payment recipient

AutomaticPixFirstPayment.description: Definitions for the first payment. It is considered as the user's enrollment payment for the service.

date.description: Defines the target settlement date of the first payment. If not provided, it will be settled immediately. Date format must be YYYY-MM-DD (for example: 2025-06-16)

description.description: Description for the first payment. If not provided, the description will be the same as the description of the payment request

fixedAmount.description: Fixed charge amount; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of fixed amounts, not subject to change during the validity of the consent. If it's sent, minimumVariableAmount and maximumVariableAmount cannot be provided.

minimumVariableAmount.description: Minimum amount allowed per charge; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of variable amounts. If it's sent, fixedAmount cannot be provided.

maximumVariableAmount.description: Maximum amount allowed per charge; if filled in, it represents consent for payments of variable amounts. If it's sent, fixedAmount cannot be provided.

startDate.description: Represents the expected date for the first occurrence of a payment associated with the recurrence.

expiresAt.description: Expiration date for the automatic pix authorization

isRetryAccepted.description: Indicates whether the receiving customer is allowed to make payment attempts, according to the rules established in the Pix arrangement.

interval.description: Defines the permitted frequency for carrying out transactions.

AutomaticPixPaymentErrorDetail.description: Details about an error that occurred with the automatic PIX payment

code.description:
Error codes expected during payment processing:
- SALDO_INSUFICIENTE: The selected account does not have sufficient balance to make the payment.
- VALOR_ACIMA_LIMITE: Validates if the amount exceeds the limit established [by the institution (account or channel)/in the arrangement] to allow the client to perform transactions.
- VALOR_INVALIDO: The submitted amount is not valid.
- NAO_INFORMADO: Not reported/identified by the account-holding institution.
- PAGAMENTO_DIVERGENTE_CONSENTIMENTO: Payment data differs from consent data.
- PAGAMENTO_RECUSADO_DETENTORA: [description of the reason for refusal].
- PAGAMENTO_RECUSADO_SPI: [error code according to PACS.002 reason domain table].
- CONSENTIMENTO_INVALIDO: Invalid consent (in final status).
- FALHA_INFRAESTRUTURA_SPI: Indicates a failure in the Instant Payments System (SPI).
- FALHA_INFRAESTRUTURA_ICP: Indicates a failure in the Public Key Infrastructure (ICP).
- FALHA_INFRAESTRUTURA_PSP_RECEBEDOR: Indicates a failure in the infrastructure of the Payment Service Provider (PSP) that receives the payment.
- FALHA_INFRAESTRUTURA_DETENTORA: Indicates a failure in the infrastructure of the institution holding the information or resources.
- TITULARIDADE_INCONSISTENTE: Account currently not associated with the CPF/CNPJ of the long-term consent.
- LIMITE_PERIODO_VALOR_EXCEDIDO: The transaction cannot be performed because the amount parameterized in the consent has been exceeded.
- LIMITE_PERIODO_QUANTIDADE_EXCEDIDO: The transaction cannot be performed because the quantity parameterized in the consent has been exceeded.
- LIMITE_VALOR_TOTAL_CONSENTIMENTO_EXCEDIDO: The transaction amount exceeds the global consent limit.
- LIMITE_VALOR_TRANSACAO_CONSENTIMENTO_EXCEDIDO: The transaction amount exceeds the per-transaction limit set in the consent.
- LIMITE_TENTATIVAS_EXCEDIDO: The maximum number of settlement attempts allowed by the arrangement has been reached.
- CONSENTIMENTO_REVOGADO: The payment was associated with a consent that has been revoked.
- FORA_PRAZO_PERMITIDO: The request time or period does not allow scheduling by the holder.
- DETALHE_TENTATIVA_INVALIDO: The parameter(s) [field_name(s)] entered for the new payment attempt do not match the original failed payment and are not allowed in the new attempt.
- DETALHE_PAGAMENTO_INVALIDO: Validates if a given parameter provided complies with the business rules.

ScheduleAutomaticPixPaymentRequest.description: Request to schedule an Automatic PIX payment

date.description: The payment date, which must fall between D+2 and D+10. Date format must be YYYY-MM-DD (for example: 2025-06-16)

RetryAutomaticPixPaymentRequest.description: Request to retry an automatic PIX payment

date.description: The date to retry the payment within a 7-day window. Date format must be YYYY-MM-DD (for example: 2025-06-16)
